Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2009 09:38AM jseda wrote: Not a big deal!!! Its a very small diameter wire; like ortho wire. You're are numbed up so all you feel is a little pressure. I've had it done twice and re-done from every which angle and its not a big deal. You want them to mark your cancer correctly so highely recommend being more concerned that the accuracy be your primary concern. You will be fine. Once the anesthetic wears off, prior to your surgery, you may feel a little pressure but nothing you can't stand or need to take any med for. Good luck!! J.Seda
Posts.Title: does the wire hurt in an excisional biopsy?? debnyc JCinAZ
